result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Shawn W Jessie was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court IMPOSES a sentences Mr. Jessie to 60 months in the Wisconsin State Prison, consisting of 30 months of Initial Confinement and 30 months of Extended Supervision, this sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being. The Court finds that Mr. Jessie IS eligible for Substance Abuse Programming

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Jessie on Probation for a term of 3 years.
Consecutive to: any sentence in being
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period

--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 

--Victim Impact panel attendance

--6 demerit points assessed

--give DNA sample upon demand

--no possession or consumption of alcohol

--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval

--absolute sobriety
 
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
 
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: WSP

FORTHWITH
 --To serve  160 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH, followed immediately by 120  days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order)

--The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:03pm [mo]
Defendant Shawn W Jessie in court with Attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2
ADA Shock orally motions to dismiss Case 15TR5061; no objection from Atty. Stangl
--The Court grants the motion to dismiss case 15TR5061

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Jessie

On Count #1 of the Amended Information:
The Court IMPOSES a sentences Mr. Jessie to 60 months in the Wisconsin State Prison, consisting of 30 months of Initial Confinement and 30 months of Extended Supervision, this sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being. The Court finds that Mr. Jessie IS eligible for Substance Abuse Programming

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Jessie on Probation for a term of 3 years, with the following conditions
 --To serve  160 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH, followed immediately by 120  days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order)
The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process.

--Comply with ALL conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--To pay fine of $4500 + costs
--to pay $56.74 in blood testing fees

The Court orders outright: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed
--give DNA sample upon demand

2 days credit
recess: 3:34pm
Final status/scheduling conference on April 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Letters submitted on behalf of Defendant

[MK] cases #15CF213 & #15TR5061 called at 9:21am. 
Defendant Shawn W Jessie in court with Attorney Patrick J Stangl.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases are scheduled for Final Status-Scheduling Conference and Final Pretrial today. 
Counsel indicate that the Defendant's Motion to Collaterally Attack the Prior Conviction is conceded by the State. 
ADA Hall files an Amended Information. 
Attorney Stangl submits letters regarding the treatment Mr. Jessie has engaged in.  Attorney Stangl informs the Court that Mr. Jessie's application for Alcohol Treatment Court admission is scheduled for this Wednesday. On request of the Defense, the Court adjourns the FSSC to Thursday at 3:00pm.   
The Court continues the Bond. 
Service of the Amended Information admitted; reading is waived.
The Defense maintains its pleas of "Not Guilty" , 
recess 9:27am.

[MK] case called at 1:20pm. 
Defendant Shawn W Jessie appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (for bond purposes only).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to counsel given.  Attorney Svehlek indicates that she has provided Mr. Jessie with a form to complete, to petition for the appointment of counsel. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and minimum/maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Mr. Jessie is not to be released from Jail until he has the SCRAM bracelet is installed.   **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 1:27pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/29/15 at 10:40am,  (2) Status Conference on 8/17/15 at 8:30am.
